meanings.definition: The study of magnetic fields and their effects on objects.
meanings.sent1: In magnetics, scientists explore how magnets attract or repel each other.
meanings.sent2: The school library has many books on magnetics and electromagnetism.
meanings.sent3: The magnetics professor's office was filled with various magnetic toys and gadgets.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of magnetics was like a compass always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The children's science fair project on magnetics amazed the judges.

meanings.definition: The properties or behavior of magnetic materials.
meanings.sent1: The magnetics of the new alloy made it perfect for use in electronic devices.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the magnetics of different metals to see which ones were attracted to magnets.
meanings.sent3: The magnetics of the fridge magnet seemed to have a mind of its own, moving around mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: The magnetics of the situation drew them together like two opposite poles of a magnet.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the magnetics of the material helped them design a better magnetic levitation system.

meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with magnets and magnetic fields.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a career in magnetics to learn more about the Earth's magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: The museum's exhibit on magnetics fascinated visitors of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The magnetics class had a field trip to a magnet factory to see magnets being made.
meanings.sent4: The magnetics department at the university was known for its groundbreaking research.
meanings.sent5: His passion for magnetics led him to invent a new type of magnetic compass.
